nodes.text: The Grek-class troop shuttle was a Corellian Engineering Corporation shuttle design used by the Imperial Navy, as well as other fleets.

It was 30 meters long, shaped approximately like the Aurebesh letter Grek, armed with a computer-controlled laser cannon, and could transport up to 50 troops, with minimal cargo on the side. The crew amounted to a pilot and co-pilot.
Grek-class shuttles were often stationed aboard Nebulon-B frigates for use by the Imperial forces.
